p: It was reported that the sedative and anxiolytic activity of the plant extract result from its high alkaloids and flavonoids, which have a stronger binding affinity with GABA-ergic complex [ 71]. Binding of flavonoids to GABA type C receptors in the CNS leads to the activity of benzodiazepine-like molecules [ 72]. A study has found that the phenolic contents in plant extract are responsible for the CNS depressant effect [ 73]. During the quantitative phytochemical analysis of MEBJ, total phenolic content was found 718 ± 3.46 mg GAE/g, and the total flavonoid content was 116.67 ± 0.07 mg QE/g dried plant extract ( Table 1). As our study reported high content of phenol and flavonoids in MEBJ, it is predicted that these phytoconstituents might be responsible for the observed activities in the CNS.
